news_header: HSBC announces a major structural overhaul, splitting into eastern and western markets and appointing its first female finance chief.
news_text: HSBC's new CEO, Georges Elhedery, has revealed a significant restructuring of the bank, dividing operations into eastern and western markets to address geopolitical tensions and reduce costs. The bank will simplify its structure into four main units, merging commercial and institutional banking divisions, with changes effective from 2025. A leadership reshuffle includes the appointment of the first female finance chief in HSBC's history. The new structure aims to enhance agility and focus on strategic priorities, with a particular emphasis on wealth management in the Middle East and other high-opportunity regions.
